Variable.Name: x1
Variable.Comment: x1 coordinate of leftmost position of main scale

Variable.Name: x2
Variable.Comment: x2 coordinate of left position of main scale

Variable.Name: y1
Variable.Comment: used in the markings top scale position

Variable.Name: y3
Variable.Comment: y3 lowest position of main scale

Variable.Name: points
Variable.Comment: points of drawing for main scale

Variable.Name: x7
Variable.Comment: grey part starting coordinates top right going anticlockwise ends at bottom right corner

Variable.Name: y7
Variable.Comment: grey part appears to be a way to draw top base y7 ={y1,y1,y3/2,y3+size2,y3,y2,y2} and {y1,y1,y1,y1+size2,y1+2*size2,y1+3*size2,y1,y3/2,y3+size2,y3,y2,y2}

Variable.Name: nm
Variable.Comment: number of marking of top scale

Variable.Name: xm
Variable.Comment: Array xm[nm] store the coordinates for all the upper marker (vertical lines) and the separation between lines is dxm.

Variable.Name: dym
Variable.Comment: height of the markings on top scale

Variable.Name: dxm
Variable.Comment: separation between the lower marker (vertical lines) lines

Variable.Name: n2s
Variable.Comment: number of ticker for the lower scale ?

Variable.Name: x6
Variable.Comment: start from top left corner anticlockwise

Variable.Name: y6
Variable.Comment: y coordinates start from top left corner anticlockwise

Variable.Name: xp
Variable.Comment: position of red line botttom x coordinate

Variable.Name: xpt
Variable.Comment: introduce by wee to make top scale pointer

Variable.Name: out
Variable.Comment: appears to be the integer value measurement in mm 16.76 = 16

Variable.Name: vs
Variable.Comment: the interval of the lower scale wee

Variable.Name: vsid
Variable.Comment: the interval of the lower scale wee identity

Variable.Name: vss
Variable.Comment: introduce by wee to draw top pointer out is the same as my vss, it is the top number

Variable.Name: oxmin
Variable.Comment: oxmin is by guess -135 - width /2 but debug to by x2 corner of lower jaw

Variable.Name: topone
Variable.Comment: topone is the top jaws used

Variable.Name: oymax
Variable.Comment: debug to be y2 bottom of jaw

Variable.Name: oymin
Variable.Comment: oymin is for the internal jaws lowest point for clearance

Variable.Name: b
Variable.Comment: is the internal diameter of the green object

Variable.Name: a
Variable.Comment: x thickness of the green object

Variable.Name: n8
Variable.Comment: number of vertices to draw green object px py

Variable.Name: x0
Variable.Comment: coordinate of start of the green object top left corner start

Variable.Name: px
Variable.Comment: top object start from top left corner anticlockwise

Variable.Name: py
Variable.Comment: top object start from top left corner anticlockwise

Variable.Name: xt
Variable.Comment: start bottom right corner and go anticlockwise

Variable.Name: oxtail
Variable.Comment: start bottom left corner and go clockwise

Osejs.View.Creation.Element.Property: if (x >= xmax-x2-1) x= xmax-x2-1; y = 0; // test for forcing no anyhow moving
if (x >= xmax-x2-1) x= xmax-x2-1; y = 0; // test for forcing no anyhow moving
if (x >= xmax-x2-1) x= xmax-x2-1; y = 0; // test for forcing no anyhow moving
if (x >= xmax-x2-1) x= xmax-x2-1; y = 0; // test for forcing no anyhow moving
"width of the object for internal jaws"
if(ymax>=b)b=ymax; //limit the max to yamx if(b<=w)b=w;
"inner width of the object for external jaws"
"depth of the object for depth stem"
" Type in your value in mm "
" Challenge yourself and key in your estimate and key ENTER, check your understanding"
"0.02 mm version 1;0.1 mm version 1;0.05 mm version 1;0.1 mm version 2;0.05 mm version 2;0.1 mm version 3;0.1 mm version 4"
slider for the lower scale of the vernier caliper
"show magnify, uncheck to resume normal mouse click use"
